summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling and detailing the logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment. It outlines COVID-19 protocols, public access via video feed and teleconference, and requires the government and defense to notify the court of any victims or family members wishing to attend.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, scheduled for arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, scheduling the arraignment and setting the logistical and public access protocols.

events.title: Arraignment on S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: Scheduled arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in Courtroom 24B of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse.

events.title: Deadline for Victim and Family Attendance Notification
events.description: Deadline for the Government to notify the court if any alleged victims wish to attend the arraignment, and for defense counsel to notify if any of Maxwell's family members wish to attend.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on a superseding indictment (S2) was scheduled for April 23, 2021.
Due to significant public interest, the court arranged a public video feed and a teleconference line accommodating up to 4,000 listeners.
The order references the Crime Victims' Rights Act (18 U.S.C. ยง 3771), requiring the government to notify alleged victims of the proceeding.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were in place for courthouse entry, including a health questionnaire, temperature check, and specific mask requirements.
